Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001.synopsis: SH took SHA path in Act 3

Shadowheart_HagSwamp.synopsis: banter between Karlach and SH in a swamp

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001.synopsis: Astarion has taken the 'remain spawn' route in Act 3

Astarion_ROM_Act3_002.synopsis: Astarion has taken the 'vampire ascendent' route in Act 3

Shadowheart_Creche.synopsis: Banter between Karlach and SH in the gith creche

Gale_ROM_Act1.synopsis: Gale had first stage of romance/attraction with player - not yet anything official

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002.synopsis: SH took Selune path in Act 3

Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_4.text: Couldn't find you for a while at the party. Was hoping we could regale our friends with a nice three-horned duet.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: Ah, I just needed a moment of quiet, to think, that's all.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_3.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_ROM_Act1_001_3.text: Well yeah! One thing I'll say for the Hells, the gossip is excellent. Faerûn's a funeral parlour by comparison.

Gale_MountainPass_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_MountainPass_2.text: There used to be a monastery in this region known for producing a wonderful ale.

Gale_MountainPass_4.speaker: Karlach
Gale_MountainPass_4.text: That sounds like heaven! Wait. Used to?

Gale_MountainPass_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_MountainPass_0.text: Oh, yes - long ruined, I'm afraid. No chance of a frothing pitcher awaiting us there, but still - at least your thirst for knowledge is quenched.

Gale_MountainPass_1.speaker: Karlach
Gale_MountainPass_1.context: NodeContext: Groaning at Gale's cringe joke

Wyll_ThormMausoleum_1.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_ThormMausoleum_1.text: No shadow curse here. Wonder why.

Wyll_ThormMausoleum_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ThormMausoleum_0.text: Couldn't say. Maybe because an entirely different curse has befallen the tomb.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_4.text: To have someone who cares about you and throw them away. I don't know how you do it.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: Any restriction, any tether must be shed. Surely you understand that? It is a form of freedom, if a tragic one.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_2.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: I've had enough tragedy in my day. You have too. But Shar's got you in a chokehold.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: It's called an embrace. I suppose you don't receive many.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_001_0.context: NodeContext: A little spicy. Arc: SH is loyal to shar.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Karlach
Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: You're old as sin, right Halsin? You must have lots of good stories.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: A few. But people always warm to the most salacious chapters.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: They forget how much I study, meditate, and as a bear - hibernate. I must have spent a hundred years or more asleep.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Halsin_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: Sleep and adventure. Maybe I'll come back as a bear in some future life.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_5.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_5.text: Sorry if this is rude, but... can vampires fall in love?

Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: What a preposterous question. Vampires can do anything you can do, and a damn sight better.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: All right, there are a few limited exceptions.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_3.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_3.text: Good to know love is on the table though.

Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_4.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act2_001_4.text: It is. Though if the table is laden with good wine and meat, love is often left to rot with the salad leaves.

Astarion_FelogyrsFireworks_2.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_FelogyrsFireworks_2.context: NodeContext: Excited in a fireworks shop

Astarion_FelogyrsFireworks_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_FelogyrsFireworks_1.text: Keep calm, Karlach. One bad flare and you could blow this whole place.

Astarion_FelogyrsFireworks_0.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_FelogyrsFireworks_0.context: NodeContext: Whispering now cause AStarion told her to calm down.

Shadowheart_BloombridgePark_3.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_BloombridgePark_3.text: Huh. There's something going on here. I don't like it.

Shadowheart_BloombridgePark_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_BloombridgePark_1.text: Are you sure it's not the flowers you're smelling? You may be allergic.
Shadowheart_BloombridgePark_1.context: NodeContext: light ribbing (they're in a park)

Shadowheart_BloombridgePark_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_BloombridgePark_0.text: But better safe than sorry, I suppose.

Astarion_Grymforge_2.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_Grymforge_2.context: NodeContext: Testing out/ listening for an echo

Astarion_Grymforge_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Grymforge_1.text: So... are you greeting invisible beings or just losing your mind?

Astarion_Grymforge_3.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_Grymforge_3.text: The echoes - listen! They're coming from three directions!

Astarion_Grymforge_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Grymforge_0.text: Losing your mind it is! Probably the tadpole - the weirdest things seem to be...

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_4.text: You look happy, Shadowheart. Like a Night Orchid in bloom.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_2.context: NodeContext: A little defensive/deflective (has started a romance with the player, but early days). Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: It must be all the fresh air since the crash - has me flush.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_001_0.context: NodeContext: A little defensive/deflective (has started a romance with the player, but early days). Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

Shadowheart_HagSwamp_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_HagSwamp_0.text: Just an insect - I'm sure you'll survive. Besides, it probably figured you for a tasty treat.
Shadowheart_HagSwamp_0.context: NodeContext: Playful, in a swamp. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_HagSwamp_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_HagSwamp_2.text: Give me an aboleth over a midge any day.

Gale_Brewery_2.speaker: Karlach
Gale_Brewery_2.text: Huh. A brewery. Why does Reithwin Ale ring a bell?

Gale_Brewery_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Brewery_0.text: It was known to be quite the tipple - a cask or two still exists, if you know the right alekeep...
Gale_Brewery_0.context: NodeContext: Enjoying being the expert on this. He definitely knows 'the right alekeep'

Gale_Brewery_3.speaker: Karlach
Gale_Brewery_3.text: You must have good taste. Not me. Can't afford it.

Gale_Brewery_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Brewery_1.text: A common misconception. Even the simplest of flavours are elevated by the choice to appreciate them. Don't deny yourself such pleasures.

Astarion_Rivington_4.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_Rivington_4.text: Nice to be in a crowd of normal people for once.

Astarion_Rivington_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Rivington_2.text: Really? I prefer my company extraordinary.

Astarion_Rivington_1.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_Rivington_1.context: NodeContext: Affectionately, assuming she's getting a compliment

Astarion_Rivington_6.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_Rivington_6.text: Excuse you. I didn't need that prick to make me who I am.
Astarion_Rivington_6.context: NodeContext: Astarion implied Gortash made her who she is.

Astarion_Rivington_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Rivington_0.text: You're right, of course. Forgive me.

Astarion_Rivington_5.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_Rivington_5.context: NodeContext: Forgiving Astarion while still a little arch.

Halsin_LastLightGraveyard_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_LastLightGraveyard_0.text: Flaming Fists, Harpers, refugees, perhaps... The shadow curse has indiscriminate taste in victims.

Halsin_LastLightGraveyard_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_LastLightGraveyard_1.text: Peace and rest are strangers in these lands, until the shadows are banished.

Shadowheart_SharTemple_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_SharTemple_2.text: Never knew Sharrans to be so... military.

Shadowheart_SharTemple_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_SharTemple_0.text: Shar's entire creed revolves around waging war against Selûne. Imagine all the generations of mortals, sacrificed in an eternal conflict between sisters.
Shadowheart_SharTemple_0.context: NodeContext: Reflective. Includes two SH lines - 'we have been at war' = SH loyal to Shar.'Shar's entire creed' = SH abandoned Shar

Shadowheart_SharTemple_3.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_SharTemple_3.text: Problem with eternal wars is they never end.

Shadowheart_SharTemple_1.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_SharTemple_1.text: Take it from me, a short, sharp personal vendetta is far less time-intensive.

Gale_BlightedVillage_2.speaker: Karlach
Gale_BlightedVillage_2.text: Looks like this town was ransacked - by soldiers, if my eyes don't deceive me.

Gale_BlightedVillage_3.speaker: Karlach
Gale_BlightedVillage_3.text: Must've been an awful day for the people who lived here.

Gale_BlightedVillage_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_BlightedVillage_0.text: If nothing else, I hope it was a mercifully short one.

Shadowheart_Moonrise_1.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_Moonrise_1.text: I'm sweating bullets. What if I blow our cover?

Shadowheart_Moonrise_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Moonrise_0.text: Simplicity is the key to a good deception. If in doubt, try thinking less.

Shadowheart_Moonrise_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_Moonrise_2.context: NodeContext: eager to follow SH's lead

Jaheira_Bonecloaks_4.speaker: Karlach
Jaheira_Bonecloaks_4.text: So, erm, Jaheira. Do you like to... that is, what do you like to do?

Jaheira_Bonecloaks_3.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Bonecloaks_3.text: As in... hobbies? Oh. Well... I like to play music, I suppose?
Jaheira_Bonecloaks_3.context: NodeContext: Taken aback by the question, wracking her brain to come up with something

Jaheira_Bonecloaks_2.speaker: Karlach
Jaheira_Bonecloaks_2.text: I'm just picturing you strumming on a harp so hard the strings snap and trying not to shriek. What do you play?

Jaheira_Bonecloaks_1.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Bonecloaks_1.text: Eh. Mostly the same children's rhyme, on a battered whistle of tin. I do not get a lot of time to practise.
Jaheira_Bonecloaks_1.context: NodeContext: A little hesitant to burst Karlach's enthusiastic bubble

Jaheira_Bonecloaks_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Bonecloaks_0.text: Oh spare me the sad eyes, girl!  Not every daily deed is worthy of song! Certainly none I can play.
Jaheira_Bonecloaks_0.context: NodeContext: Not anger - still friendly, just feeling slightly harassed by the hero worship and wants Karlach to see her as an equal.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Karlach
Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: It's funny seeing you so smitten, Minthara. Didn't think you were able.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: I took my first lover before you were a spark in your father's eye, child.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: She was a high priestess of House Vandree. Beautiful, elegant, ruthless.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_5.text: I adored her, and had been sharing her bed for some time when the order came that she must die.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_4.text: I stayed with her while the poison did its work, and whispered words of comfort as she slipped away.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Karlach
Minthara_ROM_Act3_001_1.context: NodeContext: quiet, shocked, just heard a very sad story

Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Used to your new look yet, Wyll? I for one think you look smashing.

Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: You know, I think I am. It certainly didn't put off my - er- dance partner.

Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: Ah, dance, the true language of love.

Laezel_HouseOfHope_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_HouseOfHope_2.text: Damn. I swore I'd never come back to the Hells, and here I am.

Laezel_HouseOfHope_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_HouseOfHope_1.text: Fate has a way of pulling us along with or without our approval.

Laezel_HouseOfHope_0.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_HouseOfHope_0.text: Escaping fate happens to be my speciality.

Laezel_Plains_1.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_Plains_1.text: Is this your first time on the Sword Coast, Lae'zel?

Laezel_Plains_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Plains_0.text: Yes. It is much more... lively... than the githyanki slates led me to believe.

Laezel_Plains_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_Plains_2.text: Just wait till you see Baldur's Gate. You'll never want to leave.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Hey, so, what's romance like in the Underdark, Minthara?

Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: In Menzoberranzan, romance is commonly a luxury enjoyed between women. Men are mostly present for propagation.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: Here on the surface, gender does not define one's role so strictly. There are weaklings of every sort.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_4.text: Seeing you happy is pretty wonderful, Wyll.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: Two of my real friends, finding real happiness? Together? Beautiful.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: If you get married, I'm your celebrant. Got it?

Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: As if could ever refuse you.

Gale_ROM_Act2_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Gale_ROM_Act2_001_4.text: So, Gale - got any book recommendations for me?

Gale_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_001_1.context: NodeContext: Taking the piss - knows full well Karlach can read, and that she's always claimed not to enjoy it

Gale_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Karlach
Gale_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: Very funny. Yes - I can read. School put me off big boring tomes. Sometimes I wonder what I'm missing.

Gale_ROM_Act2_001_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_001_3.text: Say no more - I'll find the perfect book for you. I might even lend it to you from my library in Waterdeep.
Gale_ROM_Act2_001_3.context: NodeContext: Jumping on the opportunity to give a book recommendation (a favourite hobby)

Gale_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Gale_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Ooh! Something with magic, please. And no devils.
Gale_ROM_Act2_001_2.context: NodeContext: i.e. 'anyone who would reject you, Wyll, just can't appreciate you.'

Wyll_CountingHouse_3.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_CountingHouse_3.text: Feel that? Guards are giving us the stink-eye.

Wyll_CountingHouse_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_CountingHouse_0.text: Possibly. But I wager there's something deeper at work here.

Laezel_Forest_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_Forest_2.text: Ahh, smell that? Fresh forest air.

Laezel_Forest_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Forest_1.text: I smell only fear - the fear of cowards lying in wait for an ambush.

Laezel_Forest_3.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_Forest_3.text: You can take a day off once in a while, Lae'zel.

Laezel_Forest_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Forest_0.text: I do not take days off. I'd even forego sleep, if such a thing were feasible. The one advantage an elf holds over a githyanki.

Laezel_IllithidColony_1.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_IllithidColony_1.text: Look at all this mucus. Wonder if our nautiloid came from down here.

Laezel_IllithidColony_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_IllithidColony_0.text: It's a possibility. This is no mere mind flayer colony, but an entire ghaik bastion.

Laezel_IllithidColony_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_IllithidColony_2.context: NodeContext: With determination, not trying to make a joke strictly.

Laezel_Monastery_1.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_Monastery_1.text: What a sight. We should stop for a nice little lunch, take it all in.

Laezel_Monastery_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Monastery_0.text: Is the worm gnawing at your grey matter? We must find a crèche and be purified.

Laezel_Monastery_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_Monastery_2.text: True. Fine. First, purify the tadpole, then a little lunch.

Astarion_Docks_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Docks_1.text: I'm... not sure, honestly. It's been a couple of hundred years.

Astarion_Docks_0.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_Docks_0.text: You're missing out! Loved it as a kid. This water looks nasty as hell, though.

Astarion_Docks_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Docks_3.text: Well, it's not called 'Grey Harbour' for nothing.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_0.text: I can tell when we're getting close to a mind flayer area because everything starts to smell purple.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_2.text: That's either profoundly poetic or childishly simple. I'm going with poetic.

Shadowheart_MorphicPool_1.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_MorphicPool_1.text: A compliment from Shadowheart! I'll put it on the shelf with the rest of my achievements.

Wyll_LastLightProtected_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_LastLightProtected_0.text: I intend to find out. But we should scout around first, see who's in need of help.

Wyll_LastLightProtected_2.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_LastLightProtected_2.text: You're good at staying in character, I'll give you that.

Laezel_Underdark_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_Underdark_2.text: Beautiful. Lethal. The Underdark is everything I thought it'd be.

Laezel_Underdark_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Underdark_1.text: And I. This environ seems worthy of a githyanki warrior's estimation.

Laezel_Underdark_3.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_Underdark_3.text: Ah, to be deemed worthy by the great Lae'zel of Crèche K'liir.
Laezel_Underdark_3.context: NodeContext: Sincere, but a little grandiose.

Laezel_Underdark_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Underdark_0.text: Continue as you have, Karlach, and you will achieve the same.

Gale_BlushingMermaid_3.speaker: Karlach
Gale_BlushingMermaid_3.text: Man, it's good to be home. First round on who?

Gale_BlushingMermaid_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_BlushingMermaid_2.text: She who thirsts buys drinks the first.
Gale_BlushingMermaid_2.context: NodeContext: Like it's a well-known saying (first half)

Gale_BlushingMermaid_1.speaker: Karlach
Gale_BlushingMermaid_1.text: You won't pin me down with a rhyme, wizard!

Gale_BlushingMermaid_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_BlushingMermaid_0.text: She who declines gets the worst of the wines.
Gale_BlushingMermaid_0.context: NodeContext: Like it's a well-known saying (second half)

Shadowheart_Forest_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_Forest_2.text: Ahh. Flowers, leaves, grass. Can't beat it.
Shadowheart_Forest_2.context: NodeContext: Admiring the natural world for the first time in a decade

Shadowheart_Forest_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Forest_1.text: I was raised in the city - I'm more used to feeling cobblestones underfoot than grass and fallen leaves.
Shadowheart_Forest_1.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is still loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_Forest_3.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_Forest_3.text: Before I went to Avernus, I'd have agreed with you. Nothing quite like Baldur's Gate, is there?

Shadowheart_Forest_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Forest_0.context: NodeContext: Veiled reference to her memory loss. Arc: SH is still loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: Well, isn't it enough that they're beautiful?
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_2.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_3.text: They remind me of some place - a place I can't quite remember. But I think I was happy there, wherever it was.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_3.context: NodeContext: Wisful. Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_001_0.context: NodeContext: A touch bashful. Arc: SH has turned from Shar.

Laezel_SCLForest_1.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_SCLForest_1.text: Do I see light? Or am I delusional?

Laezel_SCLForest_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_SCLForest_0.text: Just a mirage. There's not a spot in sight that the gloom hasn't touched.

Laezel_SCLForest_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_SCLForest_2.text: Damn, you're right. The eyes see what the heart wants.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_4.text: So our vamp isn't so heartless after all.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: Rich of you to talk about someone else's heart, Karlach.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: But I must admit, my chest has been feeling a touch lighter recently.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_001_3.context: NodeContext: Response to 'it suits you beautifully'

Shadowheart_BaldursMouth_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_BaldursMouth_2.text: I wouldn't mind doing a little shopping in the city.

Shadowheart_BaldursMouth_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_BaldursMouth_1.text: Lady Shar teaches us to abhor superficialities like fashion... though the city does have some fine boutiques. After a new look?
Shadowheart_BaldursMouth_1.context: NodeContext: SH: 'Same...' = SH abandoned Shar. 'Lady Shar abhors...' = SH loyal to Shar

Shadowheart_BaldursMouth_0.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_BaldursMouth_0.text: I'm ten years behind; don't want the youths to think I'm not, you know, up with the times.

Laezel_WyrmsRock_4.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_WyrmsRock_4.text: You know, I've always kind of hated this place. Such ado about a damned bridge.

Laezel_WyrmsRock_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_WyrmsRock_2.text: It's just a bridge. Is it really worth all that ire?

Laezel_WyrmsRock_1.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_WyrmsRock_1.text: C'mon, isn't there something you hate for no good reason?

Laezel_WyrmsRock_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_WyrmsRock_0.text: Hm. I dislike owls. Their hyper-mobile necks are quite disconcerting.

Laezel_WyrmsRock_3.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_WyrmsRock_3.text: You know what, Lae? I couldn't agree more.

Shadowheart_ReithwinTown_1.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_ReithwinTown_1.text: Since you're the only one in good form out here, I'll trust you to lead the way, Shadowheart.

Shadowheart_ReithwinTown_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ReithwinTown_0.text: It's a deal, so long as you watch my back.
Shadowheart_ReithwinTown_0.context: NodeContext: SH: 'Actually... I've been stripped ' = SH turned from Shar. 'It's a deal' = SH loyal to Shar.

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_4.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_4.text: I never was a sucker for a smooth-talker, but I admit, Astarion, you're pretty slick.

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: And you're rather the opposite of slick. Do you have a point?

Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_2.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act1_001_2.text: Step one of starting a conversation: think before you speak.

Minsc_BhaalTemple_2.speaker: Karlach
Minsc_BhaalTemple_2.text: What a pesthole! Can't wait to clear this place out.

Minsc_BhaalTemple_1.speaker: Minsc
Minsc_BhaalTemple_1.text: There will be much trading of threats and insults, no doubt. But Minsc will be ready when it is time for boot to meet butt.
Minsc_BhaalTemple_1.context: NodeContext: Descending into the Bhaal Temple for a confrontation with Orin. Minsc and Karlach just want to skip the drama and get to the fighting.

Gale_Tollhouse_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Tollhouse_0.text: You wouldn't be the first, I'd wager. It's been some time since these walkways felt the carpenter's hammer.

Gale_Tollhouse_3.speaker: Karlach
Gale_Tollhouse_3.text: You gonna catch me if I eat a brick?

Gale_Tollhouse_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Tollhouse_1.text: With my reflexes? I'd catch you before you so much as stubbed a toe.

Laezel_RoadToSCL_1.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_RoadToSCL_1.text: Lae'zel, do you want to talk about what happened at the crèche?

Laezel_RoadToSCL_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_RoadToSCL_0.text: Trust me. You'll know when I'm ready to discuss it.

Laezel_RoadToSCL_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_RoadToSCL_2.text: Fair enough. But if you change your mind...

Laezel_RoadToSCL_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_RoadToSCL_3.text: It is not a matter of mind. It is a matter of faith - and I have been put to the test.

Astarion_Plains_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Plains_1.text: What's so funny? You haven't got some laughing curse, have you?

Astarion_Plains_3.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_Plains_3.text: I really made it out of Avernus. It's incredible.
Astarion_Plains_3.context: NodeContext: Still with a laugh to herself.

Astarion_Plains_0.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_Plains_0.text: All right, just keep it down. We're conspicuous enough without your hyena call.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_3.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_3.text: You know, Astarion, I'm not sure I can trust you anymore. You're... different. A bit scary, to be honest.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_1.speaker: Astarion
Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_1.text: I have one person who trusts me completely. That's enough for me.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_0.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_0.text: Treat them right, or you'll have me to answer to.

Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_2.speaker: Karlach
Astarion_ROM_Act3_002_2.text: I can whittle up a good stake in no time if the mood takes me.

Wyll_SharTemple_2.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_SharTemple_2.text: You know, even devils like a good joke. Why are Sharrans so... dour?

Wyll_SharTemple_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_SharTemple_0.text: Their belief is grounded in loss. Hardly a laughing matter.

Wyll_SharTemple_1.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_SharTemple_1.text: The loss of all joy. Sad business.

Laezel_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: The under-harnesses are often used for strapping oneself onto a red dragon.

Laezel_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: Fashion and function. You lot really have it all figured out.

Halsin_Battlefield_1.speaker: Karlach
Halsin_Battlefield_1.text: I can almost reconstruct this battle in my mind. Unfortunately.

Halsin_Battlefield_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Battlefield_0.text: At least you were not present. Grim as it is now, it was worse on the day of the battle. A vivid wound upon my memory.

Halsin_Battlefield_2.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Battlefield_2.text: I was lucky - I lived, when so many did not. It would take me a day and a night to recite the names of all the friends I lost.

Shadowheart_MoonrisePrison_1.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_MoonrisePrison_1.context: NodeContext: Not surprised or excited, jusst noting them.

Shadowheart_MoonrisePrison_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MoonrisePrison_0.text: More like soon-to-be tadpole residences. Every infected prisoner will just make things harder on us...

Shadowheart_MoonrisePrison_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_MoonrisePrison_2.text: Let's go blast a brine pool, then.

Gale_Underdark_2.speaker: Karlach
Gale_Underdark_2.text: Just when I was getting used to the sky again...

Gale_Underdark_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Underdark_0.text: Fear not, Karlach. Sun, moon and stars will still be there waiting for us.

Gale_Underdark_3.speaker: Karlach
Gale_Underdark_3.text: Meanwhile, this place is pretty spectacular, isn't it?

Gale_Underdark_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Underdark_1.text: No book or painting could ever do its strange beauty justice. But perhaps our stories might, when we return to the surface.
Gale_Underdark_1.context: NodeContext: Agreeing with Karlach, enjoying the sense of wonder as you explore

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: It's good to see you smiling, Lae'zel.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: A momentary spasm of the jaw. But perhaps there is cause.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_2.text: Even in this dark hour, there are some things to take heart in.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: Couldn't have said it better myself.

Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_0.text: It is the sheen of the soldier's sweat on my brow.

Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_2.text: The soldier's sweat? Or the lover's?

Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act2_001_1.text: Kain'cha... Speak on it no further.

Gale_SCLForest_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_SCLForest_0.text: Oh, you know... Still alive and kicking, despite being surrounded on all sides by an endless manifestation of darkness and decay...
Gale_SCLForest_0.context: NodeContext: Almost with a sigh - that's just how things are. Grim humour to it.

Gale_SCLForest_2.speaker: Karlach
Gale_SCLForest_2.text: I feel it too. Here if you need a pick-me-up.

Shadowheart_Creche_1.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_Creche_1.text: Gotta respect these gith. They don't fool around.

Shadowheart_Creche_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Creche_0.text: Oh I'm more than aware, trust me. I've had plenty of training in what to expect from them.
Shadowheart_Creche_0.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to shar/ her shar worship is known

Shadowheart_Creche_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_Creche_2.text: In that case, lead on, miss.

Shadowheart_Creche_3.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Creche_3.text: I'll certainly be treading very carefully, trust me.
Shadowheart_Creche_3.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to Shar/her shar worship is not known

Gale_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_2.text: Karlach... a hypothetical question for you:

Gale_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_1.text: If someone - not me, of course - detected a hint of romantic interest in them from another, unnamed individual, what might that someone do about it?

Gale_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Karlach
Gale_ROM_Act1_0.text: Whoever it is, just talk to them, Gale. And leave out the hypotheticals.

Gale_ROM_Act1_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_3.text: Talking. Right. I'm good at that.

Wyll_Riverbank_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Riverbank_0.text: It would be my pleasure, Karlach - once the Absolute's been crushed for good.

Wyll_Riverbank_1.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_Riverbank_1.text: Heroics don't leave half enough time for messing.

Halsin_MoonriseAssault_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_MoonriseAssault_0.text: I doubt many will seek to surrender. But if they do... mercu costs us nothing, Karlach.

Halsin_Guildhall_2.speaker: Karlach
Halsin_Guildhall_2.context: NodeContext: Trying to suppress her excitement.

Halsin_Guildhall_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Guildhall_1.text: Then let it brew. Some radical thinkers claim that peace is a valid option, you know.

Halsin_Guildhall_0.speaker: Karlach
Halsin_Guildhall_0.text: And miss a good barroom brawl? Not me, sir.

Gale_MoonriseDocks_1.speaker: Karlach
Gale_MoonriseDocks_1.text: We're not taking a boat to Baldur's Gate, right?

Gale_MoonriseDocks_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonriseDocks_0.text: And give the Absolute free reign to use us as target practice from the banks? I think not.

Gale_MoonriseDocks_2.speaker: Karlach
Gale_MoonriseDocks_2.text: Phew. My mum always said the Chionthar was unlucky.

Jaheira_WaterqueensHouse_2.speaker: Karlach
Jaheira_WaterqueensHouse_2.text: This place is so peaceful. Maybe I should convert.

Jaheira_WaterqueensHouse_1.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_WaterqueensHouse_1.text: I've done my share of praying to her, though not for the cause of peace. My faith was suddenly found on choppy seas.

Jaheira_WaterqueensHouse_0.speaker: Karlach
Jaheira_WaterqueensHouse_0.text: I don't know what that means.

Wyll_NorthAlleys_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_NorthAlleys_0.text: I reckon there wasn't much merry-making in the Hells.

Wyll_NorthAlleys_2.speaker: Karlach
Wyll_NorthAlleys_2.text: You reckon right. Maybe for the best though. My singing is worse than demonic screeching.

Wyll_NorthAlleys_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_NorthAlleys_1.text: Hm - perhaps your talent lies in dancing, instead?

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_3.speaker: Karlach
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_3.text: How's the orb treating you, Gale?

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_1.text: Oh, quite well as a matter of fact. Since it was stabilised, it's been humming along nicely.
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_1.context: NodeContext: Upbeat, things are looking up

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_0.text: I have noticed one adverse side-effect. I seem to be losing hair in some, er, unexpected places.
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_0.context: NodeContext: Upbeat mood wavering - this is a bit embarassing

Gale_ROM_Act3_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Gale_ROM_Act3_001_2.context: NodeContext: i.e. 'anyone who would reject you, Wyll, just can't appreciate you.'

Gale_MoonriseApproach_1.speaker: Karlach
Gale_MoonriseApproach_1.text: Ready to enter the belly of the beast?

Gale_MoonriseApproach_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_MoonriseApproach_0.text: It's the stairs I'm dreading. I shall close my eyes, and pretend I'm climbing my own, far superior tower in Waterdeep.
Gale_MoonriseApproach_0.context: NodeContext: Facing an obstancle with cheery determination

Shadowheart_MoonriseOubliette_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_MoonriseOubliette_0.text: Nothing wrong with a nice subdued ambience. It can help flatter even the homeliest of faces.
Shadowheart_MoonriseOubliette_0.context: NodeContext: a little cheeky cause KArlach is teasing her.

Shadowheart_MoonriseOubliette_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_MoonriseOubliette_2.text: I'll try to keep my fire a gentle throb.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_2.text: Must be lovely to have a swim without boiling all the fishes alive.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.text: Sounds pleasant to swim with you. At a distance. It's usually so freezing.
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_0.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH has turned from Shar. Previously learned to swim with her lover.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.speaker: Karlach
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_002_1.text: Don't ask me to make a hot spring for you two. It might work. But I also might cook you like lobsters.

Jaheira_SteelWatch_2.speaker: Karlach
Jaheira_SteelWatch_2.text: These Steel Watchers are big as hell.

Jaheira_SteelWatch_1.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_SteelWatch_1.text: All the more cracks and crevices for a wild-shape to ferret into - gum up the works a little.
Jaheira_SteelWatch_1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed by the size / might of Steel Watchers.

Jaheira_SteelWatch_0.speaker: Karlach
Jaheira_SteelWatch_0.text: I'd give my other horn to watch that.
